context: Postwar broadcast coverage was extended to Birmingham in 1949 with the opening of the Sutton Coldfield transmitting station, and by the mid-1950s most of the country was covered, transmitting a 405-line interlaced image on VHF.[original research?]
count: 1. How many transmitting stations were opened in 1949?
2. How many lines were used to transmit the image?
3. By how many years was the country covered?
4. How many countries were covered by the transmitting station?
5. What was the purpose of the transmitting station?
yesno: 1.Did post-war broadcast coverage extend to Birmingham in 1949?
2.Was the Sutton Coldfield transmitting station the reason for this extension?
3.Did most of the country have access to 405-line interlaced image transmission by the mid-1950s?
4. Was VHF the only means of transmission available?
5. Was this level of coverage uniform throughout the country?
